Experience Commodity Cost Manager Intel Corporation September 2013  – Present (2 years) Dalian, Liaoning, China -Lead the effort to develop and implement effective systems in the areas of commodities and commodity planning for the both fab start up and sustaining operations.  
- Work closely with Finance, Material, Process Engineering, Install/Qualification and Manufacturing to develop an effective, low cost commodity strategy. 
-Lead team to do the Commodity cost forecast/ budget allocation based on should cost model, analyze variance and trends, support finance for the monthly close, develop POR un-landed adjustment closure roadmap. 
-Provides varying levels of advice and Commodity cost information to operational business groups or factories to drive the business decision-making. 
-Develops solutions to a broad mix of moderate to complex business challenges. Cost Project Manager Intel Corporation March 2013  –  September 2013  (7 months) Dalian, Liaoning, China -Partner with Finance co-lead the XX wafer cost project, set up the model, provided analysis and advice to ops and management team for their decision making.  
-Partner with buyer/logistics/ co-lead the BHAG projects cost analysis, drive cost reduction in the whole site. Supplier Service Program Analyst Intel Corporation May 2011  –  March 2013  (1 year 11 months) Dalian, Liaoning, China Playing a key role in the supplier management for field service support requirements on all capital equipment for Fab 68. Responsibilities center on determining and implementing the correct service support models over time to cost-effectively maintain the fab equipment. . Main work included: 
- Implementing Supplier management systems including contract management and supplier improvement  
- Providing ongoing cost tracking, forecasting, presentations, and others to hit SSP cost goals and overall supplier management  
- Working with our training counterparts to implement the SSP strategy; to understand, forecast, and obtain commitments for the training capacity to start-up the tools and reduce costs over time as the fab ramps  
- Establishing and running systems to bring in and assimilate green badge personnel, follow up with stakeholders and suppliers on service and quality issues, and others  
- Partnering with key internal/external stakeholders to identify and implementing solutions so waste elimination benefits and cost reduction are realized  
- Interfacing with SSP counterparts in other Intel factories to understand and build on lessons learned from previous start-ups . Senior Associate PwC November 2010  –  May 2011  (7 months) Dalian, Liaoning, China Lead team perform the annual audit for the company in Pharmaceuticals and ship industry. 
Took full responsibility for the audit work of the sales, cost; prepared the audit report and composed the analytical review memo to partner; negotiated with the client for the audit adjustment. Summary I am a passionate and hardworking second year Marketing BA (Hons) student. I am currently looking for an industrial placement in the technology industry to further my skills and experience.  
 
Prior to starting my degree I worked for Trust Systems (an IT Reseller) as a Marketing Assistant. I was working with Microsoft, Cisco, VMware, IBM and NetApp raising funding to market and resell their products. I have also worked for the Halifax Bank as a Cashier and Banking Adviser where I gained experience working at the fore front of a large financial organisation.  I am a hardworking individual who relishes a new challenge. I enjoy working with a team of people and working on new and innovative ideas to expand the business. I have a great deal of customer facing experience in a sales environment. 
 
I have engineered my previous work experience and studying to build a platform that, when developed will enable me to work in, and eventually run a busy forward thinking Marketing department.  Summary I am a passionate and hardworking second year Marketing BA (Hons) student. I have engineered my previous work experience and studying to build a platform that, when developed will enable me to work in, and eventually run a busy forward thinking Marketing department.  Experience Sales Program Analyst Intel Corporation July 2015  – Present (2 months) Swindon, United Kingdom Customer Service Assistant Marks and Spencers - Moto Hospitality June 2014  –  August 2014  (3 months) Leigh Delamere • My main roles were to serve the customers and upsell products, product placement and ensure the Marks and Spencer’s brand was upheld at all times.  
• I recieved full marks in two mystery shops which resulted in the General manager recommending my customer service skills. 
• I was nominated employee of the month as a result of my hard work and customer service. Competition entered Michael Spiers Jewellers March 2014  –  April 2014  (2 months) Plymouth, United Kingdom I was chosen as one of ten students from Plymouth University Business School to conduct market research for Michael Spiers. The research was to show the company how they could best target and appeal to the under 30 year old's target market. I then came up with a marketing strategy related to my results to show how the company could appeal to the audience. Marketing Assistant Trust Systems Ltd March 2013  –  August 2013  (6 months) Trust Systems are an IT Company who sell and market products from a number of large IT organisations including IBM, Cisco, NetApp, VMware, Microsoft, Arrow ECS and Citrix. I have Experience of working directly with these companies to acquire marketing funds for our campaigns to promote their products. This involved proposing our campaign ideas based on engaging with the company sales teams. 
 
I was involved in email campaigns, which involved customer segmentation techniques. This included creating HTML templates and sending them to the customer base. I sent out an email, which generated the highest customer response than any emails that had previously been sent.  
 
I was responsible for social media activities. Which means I have experience of using ‘twitter’ to gain recognition for Trust Systems. I have been on an IBM ‘Social Media Boot camp’ course which taught me how to target the correct audience and generate more brand awareness. To generate more awareness I used Hootsuite to post to LinkedIn Twitter. I was delighted that one of my Twitter ‘tweet’s’ was ‘re-tweeted’ by NetApp’s UK Sales Director. 
 
I was involved in a Marketing Campaign to sell a partner product. I worked on a ‘have your cake and twEAT it’ campaign. I was involved in gaining funding for the campaign from partner organisations. The campaign involved sending cakes with personalized messaging to key IT customers. I created the campaign brochure which included product “Why buy?” information. I designed the A5 flyers, which were all personalized with customer names. The campaign was successful and generated face-to-face appointments with an estimated sales pipeline of five hundred thousand pounds. Banking Advisor Halifax December 2011  –  February 2013  (1 year 3 months) Trowbridge/Chippenham After twelve months I was promoted to Banking Advisor at the Halifax, I had daily targets to sell bank products and overall objectives to deepen the relationship between the bank and the customer. I received leads from Cashiers but also have to generate my own leads by calling customers. While working as a Banking Advisor I studied a Certificate in retail Banking conduct of business, and became CertRBCB qualified. I was the top Banking Advisor in the Wiltshire region and I think this is because I portrayed products efficiently. This employment has shown me what is required to work in the front line of a large organisation and how to efficiently expand the business through acquiring strong relationships with customers. Customer Advisor Halifax December 2010  –  December 2011  (1 year 1 month) Trowbridge Working for the Halifax as a Customer Adviser I gained an excellent understanding of business and financial product sales. My first role as a Cashier gave me in depth knowledge into what customers buy and why. I was targeted on lead generation which involved questioning customers about their financial wellbeing to establish whether the sale of a financial product was required. Summary When people make a choice to utilize therapy to change their lives, I believe there is no greater gift they can give themselves. I am so lucky to have made helping people change their lives into my full time career.  
 
I am a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist that loves to help people find the therapy or treatment that works best for them. I've spent a lot of time investing in my knowledge so I can help turn people on the right path. In addition to being a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, I'm also a Registered Addiction Specialist and a Certified Women's Issues Specialist. I combine these certifications with additional training in Holistic Health and Buddhist Psychology. 
 
This Holistic Approach allows me to treat a whole person -- not just one issue -- to get them on the path to health. What clients like most about me is my ability to take my caring nature and combine it with my passion and ambition to help them succeed.
